maml:description.maml:para: Connects a SharePoint Online user to a SharePoint Online Site Collection. This cmdlet must be run before any other Site Collection scoped SharePoint Online cmdlets can run.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: The Connect-SPOSite cmdlet connects a SharePoint Online user to the specified SharePoint Online Site Collection.

Only a single SharePoint Online site connection is maintained from any single Windows PowerShell session. In other words, this is a per-site collection user connection. Running the Connect-SPOSite cmdlet twice implicitly disconnects the previous connection. The Windows PowerShell session will be set to serve the new SharePoint Online user and site collection specified. If you are connecting to an on-premises version of SharePoint and not SharePoint Online then use the -NetworkCredentials switch parameter to treat the provided credentials as network credentials.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
If specified then the provided credentials must be network credentials and it is assumed that you are connecting to an on-premises version of SharePoint and not SharePoint Online.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Connect-SPOSite -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Connect-SPOSite -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example connects to the Site Collection at https://contoso.sharepoint.com/.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 2-----------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $username = "admin@contoso.sharepoint.com" PS C:\> $password = "password" PS C:\> $cred = New-Object -TypeName System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $userName, $(ConvertTo-SecureString $password -AsPlainText -Force) PS C:\> Connect-SPOSite -Url "http://contoso.sharepoint.com/" -Credential $cred

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example connects to the Site Collection at https://contoso.sharepoint.com/ given a specific username and password.

maml:description.maml:para: Sends an HTTP or HTTPS request to a SharePoint Online REST-compliant web service.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: This function sends an HTTP or HTTPS request to a Representational State Transfer (REST)-compliant ("RESTful") SharePoint Online web service. The Connect-SPOSite cmdlet must be run first in order to set the credentials for the environment.
Some source code for this cmdlet was referenced from http://blog.vgrem.com/2014/02/27/working-with-the-sharepoint-online-rest-service-via-powershell/.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.

command:parameter.maml:name: Method
command:parameter.command:parameterValue: Default | Get | Head | Post | Put | Delete | Trace | Options | Merge | Patch

command:parameter.maml:name: XHTTPMethod
command:parameter.command:parameterValue: Default | Get | Head | Post | Put | Delete | Trace | Options | Merge | Patch

maml:description.maml:para: The REST endpoint URL to call.
Specifies the method used for the web request. The default value is "Get".
Specifies the body of the request. The body is the content of the request that follows the headers. You can also pipe a body value to Invoke-SPORestMethod.

The "X-RequestDigest" header to set. This is most commonly used to provide the form digest variable. Use "(Invoke-SPORestMethod -Url "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/_api/contextinfo" -Method "Post").GetContextWebInformation.FormDigestValue" to get the Form Digest value.
The "If-Match" header to set. Provide this to make sure you are not overwritting an item that has changed since you retrieved it.

To work around the fact that many firewalls and other network intermediaries block HTTP verbs other than GET and POST, specify PUT, DELETE, or MERGE requests for -XHTTPMethod with a POST value for -Method.
The OData verbosity of the data to return. Valid values are "Verbose", "MinimalMetadata", and "NoMetadata".
If the returned data is a binary data object such as a file from a SharePoint site specify the output file name to save the data to.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Invoke-SPORestMethod -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Invoke-SPORestMethod -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Connect-SPOSite -Url "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/" -Credential "admin@contoso.com" PS C:\> Invoke-SPORestMethod "https://contoso.sharepoint.com/_api/web"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example invokes the REST call at https://contoso.sharepoint.com/_api/web.

maml:description.maml:para: Disconnects from a SharePoint Online site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: The Disconnect-SPOSite cmdlet explicitly disconnects a previously created SharePoint Online site connection.
You can disconnect the site by running the Disconnect-SPOSite cmdlet or by running the Connect-SPOSite cmdlet to initiate another connection. For more information, see Connect-SPOSite.

Even after a connection is terminated, operations that were started before the connection is terminated will run to completion. In other words, long-running operations will not be terminated by running the Disconnect-SPOSite cmdlet or the Connect-SPOSite cmdlet.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Disconnect-SPOSite -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Disconnect-SPOSite -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example explicitly disconnects a previously created SharePoint Online service connection.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a web part to a web part page or wiki page.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a web part to a web part page or wiki page.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the file to add the web part to.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
Specifies the file to add the web part to.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name/list_name/file_name, or an SPOFile or SPOWikiPage object, or Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.File object.
The list to whose view will be added to the page.

The type must be a valid absolute URL, in the form http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site_name/lists/list_name, or an SPOList object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List object, List title, or GUID representing the List ID.
The name of the view to use for the list view web part.
The view schema to apply.
The title of the web part to add.
The zone to add the web part to.
The zone index to add the web part to.
The zone to add the web part to.
The zone index to add the web part to.
Add some space before the web part.
Set a specific JSLink file.
The chrome settings for the web part.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Add-SPOListViewWebPart -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Add-SPOListViewWebPart -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example adds an announcements web part to the default.aspx web part page located in the root web of the root site collection.
This example adds an announcements web part to the home.aspx wiki page located in the root web of the root site collection.

> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
The Term Group to add the Term Set to. The type must be a valid TermGroup object, SPOTermGroup object, name, or GUID.
The name of the term set to create.
The Id of the term set to create.
The description of the term set to create.
The contact for the Term Set object.
The custom sort order of the Term Set object.
If specified, the Term Set object should appear in the tagging user interface.
The user who is responsible for the current TermSet.
If specified, the Term Set can be updated by all users; otherwise, just by the specified constributors for the Group object.
The language code identifier (LCID).

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help New-SPOTermSet -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help New-SPOTermSet -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SPOTermSet -Group "My Group" -Name "My Term Set"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a single term set.

Retrieve terms that match the value exactly or just start with the value. The default value is ExactMatch.

If specified, trim Terms that are unavailable.
If specified, trim out Term objects that have Term.IsDeprecated set to true.
Indicates the maximum number of objects to include in the returned collection. The default value is 1.

This example exports a single term and saves to c:\terms.xml.

maml:description.maml:para: Applies a theme with the specified components to the specified Site.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site to apply the theme to.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
The server relative URL to the color palette file. For example: "/_catalogs/theme/15/palette001.spcolor".
The server relative URL to the font file. For example: "/_catalogs/theme/15/fontscheme001.spfont".
The server relative URL to the background image file. For example: "/Images/bg.png".
If specified, store the generated theme files in the root Site, otherwise store them in this Site.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-SPOWebTheme -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-SPOWebTheme -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example sets the theme of the root Site of the current Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Configures the specified subsite.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: The Set-SPOWeb cmdlet configures the subsite specified by the Identity parameter. Settings for any parameters that are not provided are not changed.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site to update.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the SIte ID.
Sets the URL for a custom master page file to apply to the Site.
Sets the URL of the master page that is used for the Site.
Specifies the new title of the Site.
Specifies the new description of the Site.
Sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the Site should use Minimal Download Strategy.
Sets a value that specifies whether the Quick Launch area is enabled on the Site.
Sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the Site can be saved as a Site template.
Specifies the new relative URL for the Site. This is the URL path after the site collection URL.
Sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the RSS feeds are enabled on the Site.
Sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the tree view is enabled on the Site.
Sets the user interface (UI) version of the Site.
Sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the settings UI for visual upgrade is shown or hidden.
Sets the associated member group of the Site.
Sets the associated owner group of the Site.
Sets the associated visitor group of the Site.
Creates unique role assignments for the Site.
Specifies whether to copy the role assignments from the parent Site.

The role assignments for all child Sites in the current Site and in the Sites which inherit role assignments from the current Site must be cleared and those Sites will inherit role assignments from the current Site after this call.
Resets the role inheritance for the Site and inherits role assignments from the parent Site.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-SPOWeb -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-SPOWeb -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example sets the master page of the root Site of a Site Collection to seattle.master.
This example breaks permissions inheritance for /childsite and copies the parents permissions to the Site.

If the Site contains child Sites then recursively delete all child Sites.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the details for the currently connected Site Collection.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the details for the currently connected Site Collection.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Retrieve additional details useful for examining a single object.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOContextSite -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOContextSite -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves the core details for the currently connected site.
This example retrieves the core details along with additional information such as upgrade information, event receivers, owner, etc.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new child Site within an existing Site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new child Site within an existing Site.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the parent Site to create the new Site within.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
The URL name of the Site to create. If creating a new Site at "http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site1/newsite" then specify a value of "newsite".
Specifies the Web template for the new Site. The template must already exist. If no template is specified, no template is applied and a template can be selected later.
Specifies the title of the new Site.
Describes the new Site. If no description is specified, the entry is left blank.
Specifies the language template identifier for the new Site. If no language is specified, the Site is created with the same language that was specified when the product was installed.
The type must be a valid language identifier (LCID).
Specifies that this Site is to be created with unique permissions.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help New-SPOWeb -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help New-SPOWeb -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new child site with the URL name of childsite under the root Site of the current Site Collection.
This example creates a new child site with the URL name of childsite under the sitecol1 Site of the current Site Collection (you must be connected to this site collection).

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the search configuration.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the search configuration from the current Tenant or Site Collection.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
The file path where the exported search settings will be saved.
The level at which the search settings will be imported.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Export-SPOSearchConfiguration -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Export-SPOSearchConfiguration -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the search configuration for the current Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves one or more Sites within the current Site Collection.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a single Site given the server relative URL, GUID, or existing SPOWeb object. If a Site identifier is not provided then all Sites are provided.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
The path to the file containing the search settings to import. The value can be the path a file, an XmlDocument object, or an XML string.
The level at which the search settings will be imported.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Import-SPOSearchConfiguration -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Import-SPOSearchConfiguration -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example imports a search configuration to the current Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads a specific File from a given Site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Download and save a specific file from a Site given the server relative URL to the file. The Site provided by the -Web parameter must correspond to the Site where the file is located or else an argument out of range exception will be thrown.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the File(s) to retrieve.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
The server relative URL(s) to the file(s) to retrieve.
The path to the folder to save.
Save all child folders and their files.
The path to the folder to save the files to.
Overwrite existing files.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Download-SPOFile -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Download-SPOFile -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Downloads the file MyFile.docx from the Documents library within the root Site of the current Site Collection and saves to the c:\temp folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a Folder in a list or library.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a folder in the specified list. The Site provided by the -Web parameter must correspond to the Site where the folder and List is located or else an argument out of range exception will be thrown.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the List to add the item to.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
Specifies the List to add the item to.

The type must be a valid absolute URL, in the form http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site_name/lists/list_name, or an SPOList object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List object, List title, or GUID representing the List ID.
Create the item within a subfolder inside the list. Only include the path relative to the root of the list.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help New-SPOListFolder -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help New-SPOListFolder -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SPOListFolder -Web "/" -List "Documents" -ListRelativeUrlFolderPath "My Top Level Folder/My Sub-Folder"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates the folders "My Top Level Folder/My Sub-Folder" in the Documents library within the root Site of the current Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a specific Folder from a given Site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve a specific SPOFolder object from a Site given the server relative URL to the folder. The Site provided by the -Web parameter must correspond to the Site where the folder is located or else an argument out of range exception will be thrown.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the File to retrieve.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
The server relative URL to the folder to retrieve.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOFolder -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOFolder -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the folder "My Folder" from the Documents library within the root Site of the current Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a specific File from a given Site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve a specific SPOFile object from a Site given the server relative URL to the file. The Site provided by the -Web parameter must correspond to the Site where the file is located or else an argument out of range exception will be thrown.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the File to retrieve.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
The server relative URL to the file to retrieve.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOFile -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOFile -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the file MyFile.docx from the Documents library within the root Site of the current Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new list file within an existing List.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new list file within an existing List.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the List to add the file to.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
Specifies the List to add the file to.

The type must be a valid absolute URL, in the form http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site_name/lists/list_name, or an SPOList object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List object, List title, or GUID representing the List ID.
Specifies the Folder to add the file to.
The type must be a valid SPOFolder object.
Specify the path to the file to add to the list.
Overwrite an existing file if present.

The collection of field values to set where the key is the internal field name. The type must be a hash table where each key represents the name of a field whose value should be set to the corresponding key value (e.g., @{"Field1"="Value1";"Field2"="Value2"}). Alternatively, provide the path to a file with XML property settings (<Properties><Property Name="Name1">Value1</Property><Property Name="Name2">Value2</Property></Properties>).

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help New-SPOFile -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help New-SPOFile -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SPOFile -Web "/" -List "My List" -File "c:\myfile.txt" -FieldValues @{"Title"="My new file"}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new file within the List My List under the root Site of the current Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the collection of lists or a specific list.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: If the -List parameter is not provided then all the lists the given Site are returned; otherwise, a single list will be returned matching the identifier provided.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the List to retrieve.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
Specifies the identity of the List to retrieve.

The type must be a valid absolute URL, in the form http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site_name/lists/list_name, or an SPOList object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List object, List title, or GUID representing the List ID.
Retrieve additional details useful for examining a single object.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOList -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOList -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all lists for the root Site.
Retrieves a single list for the given Site.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new list within an existing Site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new list within an existing Site.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site to create the new List within.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
The URL name of the List to create. If creating a new List at "http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site1/Lists/MyList" then specify a value of "Lists/MyList".
Specifies the title of the new List.
Describes the new List. If no description is specified, the entry is left blank.
Sets a value that specifies the List schema of the new List.
Sets a value that specifies the identifier of the document template for the new List.
Sets a value that specifies whether the new List is displayed on the Quick Launch of the Site.
Sets a value that specifies the List server template of the new List.
Sets a value that specifies the Feature identifier of the Feature that contains the List schema for the new List.
Sets a value that specifies the properties of the data source of the new List.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help New-SPOList -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help New-SPOList -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new list with the URL name of Lists/MyNewList under the root Site of the current Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new list item within an existing List.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new list item within an existing List.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the List to add the item to.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
Specifies the List to add the item to.

The type must be a valid absolute URL, in the form http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site_name/lists/list_name, or an SPOList object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List object, List title, or GUID representing the List ID.
Create the item within a subfolder inside the list. Only include the path relative to the root of the list.

The collection of field values to set where the key is the internal field name. The type must be a hash table where each key represents the name of a field whose value should be set to the corresponding key value (e.g., @{"Field1"="Value1";"Field2"="Value2"}). Alternatively, provide the path to a file with XML property settings (<Properties><Property Name="Name1">Value1</Property><Property Name="Name2">Value2</Property></Properties>).

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help New-SPOListItem -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help New-SPOListItem -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-SPOListItem -Web "/" -List "My List" -FieldValues @{"Title"="My new list item"}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new list item within the List My List under the root Site of the current Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a List from the specified Site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a List from the specified Site.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the List to delete.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
Specifies the identity of the List to delete.

The type must be a valid absolute URL, in the form http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site_name/lists/list_name, or an SPOList object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List object, List title, or GUID representing the List ID.
If specified the List will be recycled instead of deleted.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-SPOList -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-SPOList -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example removes the childsite Site from the Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Configures the specified list.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: The Set-SPOList cmdlet configures the list specified by the Identity parameter. Settings for any parameters that are not provided are not changed.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the List to update.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
Specifies the identity of the List to update.

The type must be a valid absolute URL, in the form http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site_name/lists/list_name, or an SPOList object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List object, List title, or GUID representing the List ID.
Sets a value that specifies whether Content Types are enabled for the List.
Sets a value that specifies the default workflow identifier for content approval on the List.
Sets a value that specifies the location of the default display form for the List.
Sets a value that specifies the URL of the edit form to use for List items in the List.
Sets a value that specifies the location of the default new form for the List.
Sets a value that specifies the description of the List.
Sets a value that specifies the reading order of the List. Valid values are NONE, LTR, or RTL.
Sets a value that specifies the server-relative URL of the document template for the List.
Sets a value that specifies the minimum permission required to view minor versions and drafts within the List.
Sets a value that specifies whether List item attachments are enabled for the List.
Sets a value that specifies whether new List folders can be added to the List.
Sets a value that specifies whether minor versions are enabled for the List.
Sets a value that specifies whether content approval is enabled for the List.
Sets a value that specifies whether historical versions of List items and documents can be created in the List.
Sets a value that specifies whether List items must be checked out before they can be edited.
Sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the List is hidden.
Sets a value that specifies the URI for the icon of the List.
Sets a value that specifies whether information rights management is enabled for the List.
Sets a value that specifies a flag that a client application can use to determine whether to display the List.
Sets a value that specifies the last time a List item, field, or property of the List was modified.
Sets a value that specifies that the crawler must not crawl the List.
Sets a value that specifies whether the List appears on the Quick Launch of the Site.
Sets the displayed title for the List.
Sets a value that specifies the data validation criteria for a List item.
Sets a value that specifies the error message returned when data validation fails for a List item.
Creates unique role assignments for the Site.
Specifies whether to copy the role assignments from the parent Site.

The role assignments for all child Sites in the current Site and in the Sites which inherit role assignments from the current Site must be cleared and those Sites will inherit role assignments from the current Site after this call.
Resets the role inheritance for the Site and inherits role assignments from the parent Site.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-SPOList -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-SPOList -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example sets the master page of the root Site of a Site Collection to seattle.master.
This example breaks permissions inheritance for /childsite and copies the parents permissions to the Site.

command:parameter.command:parameterValue: OneColumn | OneColumnSideBar | TwoColumns | TwoColumnsHeader | TwoColumnsHeaderFooter | ThreeColumns | ThreeColumnsHeader | ThreeColumnsHeaderFooter

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the identity of the Site containing the List to add the file to.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help New-SPOField -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help New-SPOField -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new site column using the schema definition stored within $schema.

maml:description.maml:para: Disables a Feature within the current Site Collection or a specific Site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: If the -Web parameter is not provided then a Site Collection scoped Feature will be disabled; otherwise, a Site scoped Feature for a given Site will be disabled.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site where the specified Feature will be deactivated.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Disable-SPOFeature -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Disable-SPOFeature -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Disables a Site Collection scoped Feature.
Disables a Site scoped Feature on the root Site.

maml:description.maml:para: Enables a Feature within the current Site Collection or a specific Site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: If the -Web parameter is not provided then a Site Collection scoped Feature will be enabled; otherwise, a Site scoped Feature for a given Site will be enabled.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site where the specified Feature will be activated.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Enable-SPOFeature -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Enable-SPOFeature -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Enables a Site Collection scoped Feature.
Enables a Site scoped Feature on the root Site.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the Feature definition IDs for the Site Collection or a specific Site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: If the -Web parameter is not provided then the Site Collection scoped Feature definition IDs are returned; otherwise, the Site scoped Feature definition IDs for a given Site are returned.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site whose site-scoped Features will be retrieved.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOFeature -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOFeature -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all Site Collection scoped Feature definition IDs.
Retrieves all Site scoped Feature definition IDs for the root Site.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the Event Receivers for the Site Collection or a specific Site.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: If the -Web parameter is not provided then the Site Collection scoped Event Receivers are returned; otherwise, the Site scoped Event Receivers for a given Site are returned.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site whose Event Receiver Definitions will be retrieved.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
If not specified then the current Site Collection's Event Receiver Definitions will be retrieved.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOEventReceiver -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOEventReceiver -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all Site Collection scoped Event Receivers.
Retrieves all Site scoped Event Receivers for the root Site.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new content type to an existing List.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new content type to an existing List.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the Content Type or List containing the Content Type to remove the Content Type from.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
Specifies the List to remove the Content Type from.

The type must be a valid absolute URL, in the form http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site_name/lists/list_name, or an SPOList object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List object, List title, or GUID representing the List ID.
Sets a value that specifies the Content Type to remove. The type must be a valid name, Content Type ID, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ContentType object or SPOContentType object.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-SPOContentType -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-SPOContentType -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example removes a content type with the name of My Content Type from the Documents list.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new content type to an existing List.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new content type to an existing List.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the List to create the new Content Type within.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
Specifies the List to add the Content Type to.

The type must be a valid absolute URL, in the form http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site_name/lists/list_name, or an SPOList object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List object, List title, or GUID representing the List ID.

Sets a value that specifies the Content Type that the new Content Type will inherit from. The type must be a valid name, Content Type ID, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ContentType object or SPOContentType object.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Add-SPOContentType -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Add-SPOContentType -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example adds a content type with the name of My Content Type to the Documents list.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the Content Types for the Site or List.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the Content Types for the Site or List.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site containing the List whose Content Types will be retrieved.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
If not specified then the current Site Collection's Event Receiver Definitions will be retrieved.
Specifies the identity of the List whose Content Types will be retrieved.

The type must be a valid absolute URL, in the form http://contoso.sharepoint.com/site_name/lists/list_name, or an SPOList object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List object, List title, or GUID representing the List ID.
The name or ID of the Content Type to retrieve.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOContentType -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-SPOContentType -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all the Content Types for the root Site of the current Site Collection.
Retrieves the Document Content Types from the root Site of the current Site Collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new content type within an existing Site or List.

maml:copyright.maml:para: > For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new content type within an existing Site or List.
Copyright 2016 Falchion Consulting, LLC
> For more information on this cmdlet and others:
> http://blog.falchionconsulting.com/
> Use of this cmdlet is at your own risk.
> Gary Lapointe assumes no liability.
Specifies the identity of the Site to create the new Content Type within.
The type must be a valid server relative URL, in the form /site_name, or an SPOWeb object, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.Web object, or GUID representing the Site ID.
Specifies the name of the new Content Type.
Describes the new Content Type. If no description is specified, the entry is left blank.
Describes the new Content Type. If no description is specified, the entry is left blank.

Sets a value that specifies the Content Type that the new Content Type will inherit from. The type must be a valid name, Content Type ID, Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ContentType object or SPOContentType object.
An array of internal field names to add to the content type.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help New-SPOContentType -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help New-SPOContentType -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new content type with the name of My Content Type under the root Site of the current Site Collection.
